title: Is there an equivalent to ISO 9001 certification? - Quora

response.answer_text: A few industries, notably the automotive industry, have established standards that incorporate and extend the requirements of the ISO 9001 Standard. The result is the ISO/TS 16949 standard. Because it is based on the ISO 9001 standard, it is likely to be accepted as equivalent. A similar situation may exist for your industry.

It depends on the sector as mentioned above. The most familiars are: ISO 13485 - for medicalAS 9000 - for AerospaceISO/TS 16949 - AutomotiveHowever a lot of countries have their own specific quality management standards for different sector. In Holland for example, we have HKZ, a quality standard for healthcare. However, most of these are derived of the ISO 9001.
